You might sniff a bit of nutmeg and woody notes mixed in, and there’s a leathery aroma that comes and goes quickly. The odor decently stays on your skin and lasts roughly four hours. The middle notes will treat you to a sunny and beachy accord through its blend of geranium and lime blend mixed with herbaceous oakmoss and Santolina shrubs. The base, consisting of driftwood, patchouli, and musk, creates a subtle woody fragrance that will leave you energized. If you want a fragrance that’s seductive and charming, then you should go for colognes with a spicy and woodsy aroma. A subtle, citrus odor with hints of herbs and marine accord is better for day-to-day activities like going to the office, as these perfumes aren’t that strong and overwhelming. Season Some men’s oil-based colognes have different blends that make them appropriate for certain seasons. A spicy cologne is more appropriate for cold weather or breezy evenings. On the other hand, you’ll benefit more from perfumes with aquatic scents and fruity accords if you use them during hotter months. Using the proper fragrance at the right time and place will make your investment worthwhile. Style Like the scent, personal style matters when choosing the best men’s oil-based cologne. Strong, leathery, and Ambroxan fragrances fit men who are hoping to come off as more rugged and masculine. Charming and light-hearted guys match better with perfumes that have herbal and sweet aromas. Wearing the proper cologne adds a finishing touch to your overall image. afnanperfumes / Instagram How We Chose No variation or brand can work for every guy in every setting. Some blends work better for different personalities, and others fit certain weather conditions more. I read through customer reviews and product descriptions to find the best oil-based colognes for men that would be best for certain individuals based on the following criteria: Purpose: What are you going to use the cologne for? Is it for clubbing or something you’ll wear daily? I searched for colognes that served the right purpose, as opposed to options that claimed to be the only solution for everything. Customer Reviews: Do people who used the cologne vouch for it? Customer reviews are generally a good measuring stick because if multiple people are saying the same thing, then it’s likely true. Price: You shouldn’t spend more than what you need if an affordable alternative is already available. I made sure to balance quality and price when suggesting these colognes. Why Trust Us? Joe Niehaus is an experienced product reviewer, tester, and researcher. He’s written for various notable websites like Men’s Health and Travel + Leisure. He’s covered similar categories, from the best clubbing colognes to the best cedar colognes, making him strongly familiar with what men need in oil-based colognes. Joe’s careful method of finding the best oil-based colognes includes consulting with industry experts, judging the materials and scent, and even testing brands hands-on to find how the colognes really perform. His readers get valuable first-hand experience and tailored recommendations to help make informed decisions based on real-life customer testimonials. Final Verdict  The best oil-based colognes for men should have a long-lasting scent that’s not too overpowering and has great projection when worn. The Versace Eros for Men takes you to an aromatic treat filled with refreshing herbal scent mixed with hints of spicy, woody fragrances. The scent remains on your skin for six hours, and the more than 5,000 positive reviews make this the perfect oil-based cologne to wear all day, every day. FAQ An oil-based cologne’s scent lasts longer than alcohol-based perfumes and has fewer chemicals that damage sensitive skin. It’s made from natural ingredients, you can spray it on hair and clothes, and you shouldn’t have any problems. Extrait de parfum or pure perfume (not to be confused with eau de parfum) is the most concentrated form of cologne. It’s crafted with around 20% to 40% oil concentration. You need only a couple of drops for each application when using such fragrances. When searching for Extrait de parfum, look for brands that have the label “Intense Perfume” on. html:
• Men's Grooming

We independently evaluate all recommended products and services. Any products or services put forward appear in no particular order. if you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation.

Listen, fellas. You need to smell great.

And no, I’m not talking about middle school Axe great. That stuff is cheap and goes away like a flash in a pan.

Some fragrances just don’t last long, and they’re troublesome to deal with. You don’t want to reapply them multiple times in a day just to impress a girl.

What you want is to have fun while partying in the club, mingling in the office, or getting intimate with your date.

This is where the best oil-based colognes come in. Although parfum (or extrait de parfum) has the most fragrance out of all the perfume types, eau de parfum (the ones on this list) is the most popular and has the next-highest level of fragrance.

It’s more concentrated, so the scent lasts for hours. The formula also allows the aroma to stick on the skin longer than more alcohol-based perfumes, lessening the need to reapply.

So I searched far and wide for the best oil-based men’s cologne you can buy today, so you’ll get to enjoy your special moments with more confidence and grace.

Keep reading to find the solutions that match your needs.

Key Takeaways

To unravel the best oil-based colognes for men, I looked through dozens of brands, Amazon listings, and customer reviews. The five below are the top choices I found based on smell, season, and style.

My top overall choice is the Versace Eros for Men because of its versatility and long-lasting fragrance. It’s then followed by budget-friendly AFNAN 9 PM for Men, which packs a punch for a pocket-sized perfume.


In This Article

  1. Our Picks
  2. Buying Considerations
  3. How We Chose
  4. Why Trust Us?
  5. Final Verdict
  6. FAQs

Best Overall: Versace Eros for Men 3.4 oz Eau de Parfum Spray

Why it’s great: The Versace Eros gets lots of love, and for good reason. It opens you to a fresh, minty scent before treating you to the sweet hints of vanilla. Once the top notes dry down, you’ll whiff up a subtle, spicy, and woody fragrance with a few elements of green herbs.

Eros’ inviting nature makes it suitable to wear for any occasion and season. You might find the warm, spicy notes more appropriate in the evening, especially when going out. The smell also lasts about six hours and projects nicely when worn—not too much or too little.

Who is this for? If you’ve tried a few different colognes and generally know what you like, then this is a reliable fragrance that also adds a hint of complexity compared to other scents.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: You might find the initial minty scent too strong.

Top Notes: Mint, Candy Apple, Lemon, Mandarin Orange | Middle Notes: Ambroxan, Geranium, Clary Sage | Base Notes: Vanilla, Cedar, Sandalwood, Bitter Orange, Patchouli, Leather | Type: Eau de Parfum

Best Budget: AFNAN 9 PM for Men Eau de Parfum Spray

Why it’s great: Reasonably priced at under $40, the AFNAN 9 PM for Men is an amber vanilla fragrance that adds a hint of sweetness to your masculine nature. Its scent will accompany you throughout the day without overwhelming you or anyone close to you.

The economical, pocket-friendly design makes it easy to carry around. It sprays nicely with enough force for the blend to stick to your clothes and skin. The aroma’s projection is best for intimate settings.

It’s a bit “close distance,” meaning that people have to stand beside you before they can smell the perfume, but it’s not overpowering. Overall, the sweet, sugary odor will surely make the ladies compliment you the moment they come close. That’s surely one of the best oil-based colognes.

Who is this for? This is a great option for budget-conscious guys who may just be venturing into the world of colognes. This also makes for a good stocking stuffer or one-off gift.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: The aroma may be too feminine for some men. That being said, I think a little hint of delicacy can be attractive for manly men.

Top Notes: Bergamot, Lavandin and Cinnamon, Apple | Middle Notes: Muguet,Orange Blossom | Base Notes: Patchouly, Amber, Vanilla, Tonka Bean | Type: Eau de Parfum

Best Luxury: Caswell-Massey Jockey Club Eau de Parfum

Why it’s great: If you want a cologne that will take you from Average Joe to a sophisticated gentleman, then try the Caswell-Massey Jockey Club Eau de Parfum. This fragrance comes packed with an almost 300-year-old brand history and a luxurious aroma. In fact, U.S. President John F. Kennedy was a huge fan of it.

This is one of the best oil-based colognes for men. Its opening treats you to a combination of floral scents that freshen you up for the day. The dry down will take you to a sweeter, creamier, and smoother experience, which fits well with the top notes.

After a few hours, you’ll whiff up the aroma of sandalwood that’s contrasted with a musky tone. It finishes with a soapy, 19th-century barbershop note that gives off a rugged vibe.

Who is this for? The premium perfume is for men who want to feel and smell classy. For better or worse (I’d say better), customers have noticed an “old man” smell. I wouldn’t be opposed to smelling like my grandpa, rest in peace.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: It has a costly price tag, but it has the heritage to back it up.

Top Notes: Bergamot, Carnation, Thyme | Middle Notes: Rose, Jasmine, Basil, Orris, Dew Drop | Base Notes: Ambroxan, Sandalwood | Type: Eau de Parfum

Best on Amazon: Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir

Why it’s great: Another cologne fit for proper gentlemen is the Versace Pour Homme Oud Noir. It’s an oriental woody fragrance that opens up with soft spices and a touch of citrus.

The scent’s pretty linear, so what you smell during the initial spray is pretty much it until the fragrance dries down. You might sniff a bit of nutmeg and woody notes mixed in, and there’s a leathery aroma that comes and goes quickly.

The odor decently stays on your skin and lasts roughly four hours. It projects quite well, too. People can get a whiff even when they’re four to five feet away, and there’s a sillage trail of about six to seven feet.

Who is this for? This is one of the best oil-based colognes you can get. It’s great for guys who want a dark, spicy fragrance to enhance their charm. Also, ordering on Amazon is a great deal—you get more than $100 over the typical retail price.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: It settles into a skin scent when worn for more than two hours.
